We=
ll, it turns out they don't use it in the actual test case, but in
the setU=
p/tearDown instead. Specifically to insert into/delete from a
database with=
 test-specific data, or in another case, to load only a

g wiring based on the name to improve on testing

Anyway...

It =
seems like the RunListeneer would have a reference to the currently
running=
 test, simply because of its "testStarted" and "testFinished"
functions:

/=
**
* Called when an atomic test is about to be started.
* @param descriptio=
n the description of the test that is about to be run 
* (generally a class=
 and method name)
*/

s Exception {
}

Is it possible to get access to this from within the test =
class
itself? If not, it seems like I'd have to write a custom Runner, but

nown resources for JUnit 4?
